passage: Profit margin can be significantly influenced by the accounting method used for inventory valuation. Two common methods are FIFO (First In, First Out) and LIFO (Last In, First Out). Companies may switch between these methods depending on various factors.
question: Which choice best describes data from the table that support the influence of accounting methods on profit margin?

choices.A: Both Aldon Inc. and Bromley Corp. experienced an increase in profit margin when switching from FIFO to LIFO between 2018 and 2019.
choices.B: Bromley Corp.'s profit margin remained consistent between 2018 and 2019, indicating that the accounting method does not significantly influence profit margins.
choices.C: Aldon Inc.'s profit margin increased in 2019 when using LIFO, while Bromley Corp.'s profit margin increased in 2018 when using FIFO.
choices.D: Aldon Inc.'s profit margin in 2018 was higher when using FIFO than in 2019 when using LIFO, while Bromley Corp.'s profit margin decreased in similar fashion.

explanation: D: 'Aldon Inc.'s profit margin in 2018 was higher when using FIFO than in 2019 when using LIFO, while Bromley Corp.'s profit margin decreased in similar fashion.' is the correct answer because it accurately describes the data in the table and supports the idea that profit margin can be influenced by the accounting method used.
distractor_explanation: 'Bromley Corp.'s profit margin remained consistent between 2018 and 2019, indicating that the accounting method does not significantly influence profit margins.' is incorrect because the table shows that Bromley Corp.'s profit margin decreased when switching from FIFO to LIFO.

'Aldon Inc.'s profit margin increased in 2019 when using LIFO, while Bromley Corp.'s profit margin increased in 2018 when using FIFO.' is incorrect because the table shows that Aldon Inc.'s profit margin decreased in 2019 when using LIFO.

'Both Aldon Inc. and Bromley Corp. experienced an increase in profit margin when switching from FIFO to LIFO between 2018 and 2019.' is incorrect because the table shows that both companies experienced a decrease in profit margin when switching from FIFO to LIFO.
